channel.title: Help
channel.description:
Hey guys is this a big deal? i started to get it after installing a game?
[img]http://i1107.photobucket.com/albums/h381/raylaw1/Screenshot_3_zps33efae29.png[/img]

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

[quote=“stCky, post:20, topic:548062”]Bah, she’ll be right mate.

Back up your drive onto an external, continue to play your games, if errors persist then maybe have a think about what’s most important on your hard drive, keep that and reformat then back up.[/quote]

Well I got tired of re downloading the 9gb game so i put it on a flash drive and now i have to reinstall windows 7 like every month so yeah xD

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

Bah, she’ll be right mate.

Back up your drive onto an external, continue to play your games, if errors persist then maybe have a think about what’s most important on your hard drive, keep that and reformat then back up.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:18, topic:548062”]1. Image the drive onto an external storage device. This creates a “Snapsot” of your current OS configuration as well as all files and folders.
2. Buy a new hard drive and clone the drive onto it.
3. Take the old drive, and run chkdsk, then spinrite, then gparted on it, to error check, reset bits, and realign[/quote]

Thank you for all your help

[quote=“naseem142, post:17, topic:548062”][quote author=RUNE-PK link=topic=666967.msg4469816#msg4469816 date=1422350309]
Sorry haven’t been on in a while been doing stuff and I’m not trying to grave dig or anything. There’s a topic here about help with HDD and whatnot but I replaced the disk and have only been using it for a month or two and I downloaded a pirated windows 7 ultimate and it worked perfectly fine until it started telling me to activate windows and I ignored it. But it started to crash well shut off on its own the HDD is not hot or anything why is it doing this should I activate windows? It also froze after restarting it, I finally got it to work after 3 tries of frustration but could me not activating it be the reason of why its doing this? like i said i used it for a month or two and it was fine til I started getting notifications to activate it. Please help again
[/quote]

That’s why i’d rather buy a geniune copy of windows, there is always something fishy going on with these pirated versions.[/quote]

Had no money and had to think of something else so I did that but thank you guys for your help

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

  1. Image the drive onto an external storage device. This creates a “Snapsot” of your current OS configuration as well as all files and folders.
  2. Buy a new hard drive and clone the drive onto it.
  3. Take the old drive, and run chkdsk, then spinrite, then gparted on it, to error check, reset bits, and realign

Read full topic

But it started to crash well shut off on its own the HDD is not hot or anything why is it doing this should I activate windows? It also froze after restarting it, I finally got it to work after 3 tries of frustration but could me not activating it be the reason of why its doing this? like i said i used it for a month or two and it was fine til I started getting notifications to activate it. Please help again

That’s why i’d rather buy a geniunr copy of windows, there is always something fishy going on with these pirated versions.

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

Sorry haven’t been on in a while been doing stuff and I’m not trying to grave dig or anything. There’s a topic here about help with HDD and whatnot but I replaced the disk and have only been using it for a month or two and I downloaded a pirated windows 7 ultimate and it worked perfectly fine until it started telling me to activate windows and I ignored it. But it started to crash well shut off on its own the HDD is not hot or anything why is it doing this should I activate windows? It also froze after restarting it, I finally got it to work after 3 tries of frustration but could me not activating it be the reason of why its doing this? like i said i used it for a month or two and it was fine til I started getting notifications to activate it. Please help again

item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:

i think you need a new pc

he just needs to replace that hard disk
[/quote]

Its a brand new disk only had it for like a week? but i havent got any errors after it cooled down[/quote]

It could be a defective disk

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

it’s probably not overheating, it’s the drive failing. replace it ASAP

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Well, now you know it’s a physical problem, not software. Work on getting your system cooler (and staying coolo under payload) to prevent any serious problems.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:8, topic:548062”][quote author=RUNE-PK link=topic=666967.msg4459842#msg4459842 date=1416979217]

Is the drive making any weird noises? Is it taking a long time to load anything?

No no noises not even when it overheats, it does take a few seconds to load when it is overheating tho I made a cooling box so it didn’t but after the game i start getting errors
[/quote]Try running chkdsk to see if it gives any errors

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb491051.aspx[/quote]

Ty travas

“EDIT” It stopped with the errors after I put it on my cooling box

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

Travas:

If I were you I’d start backing everything up in case of a sudden crash, and go from there.

I did start it is the hard disk going to never work again? It’s a downloaded windows 7 so idk whats wrong here

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

If I were you I’d start backing everything up in case of a sudden crash, and go from there.

Also, why is your PC overheating? Take the side panel off if it needs more air flow, and remember to clean out your fans etc. Possibly add new thermal paste to your CPU to prevent any serious problems.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

Travas:

Nope you could only lose all your information on your hard drive no big deal at all

I know this but is it overheating cause my pc has overheating problems?

And it started right once i started playing my game?

Is there any way of preventing it?

Read full topic
